Publication Title: The Evolution and Ecology of Resistance in Cancer Therapy
Publication Authors: Robert A Gatenby, Joel S Brown
Publication Abstract: Despite the continuous deployment of new treatment strategies and agents over many decades, most disseminated cancers remain fatal. Cancer cells, through their access to the vast information of the human genome, have a remarkable capacity to deploy adaptive strategies for even the most effective treatments. We note there are two critical steps in the clinical manifestation of treatment resistance.(Read more on Pubmed)

Publication Abstract: Curative therapy for metastatic cancers is equivalent to causing extinction of a large, heterogeneous, and geographically dispersed population.
